ai-sn23:1.1.2_0: Then Venerable Rādha went up to the Buddha ...
ai-sn23:1.2.3_0: “When there is form, Rādha, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
ai-sn23:1.2.4_0: So you should see form as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the abscess, the dart, the misery, the miserable.
ai-sn23:1.2.5_0: Those who see it like this see rightly.
ai-sn23:1.2.9_0: consciousness, there may be Māra, or the murderer, or the murdered.
ai-sn23:1.2.10_0: So you should see consciousness as Māra, the murderer, the murdered, the diseased, the abscess, the dart, the misery, the miserable.
ai-sn23:1.2.11_0: Those who see it like this see rightly.”
ai-sn23:1.3.1_0: “But sir, what’s the purpose of seeing rightly?”
ai-sn23:1.3.2_0: “Disillusionment is the purpose of seeing rightly.”
ai-sn23:1.3.9_0: “But sir, what is the purpose of extinguishment?”
ai-sn23:1.3.10_0: “Your question goes too far, Rādha. You couldn’t figure out the limit of questions.
ai-sn23:1.3.11_0: For extinguishment is the culmination, destination, and end of the spiritual life.”
ai-sn23:1.3.12_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn23:2.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the sentient being’.
ai-sn23:2.1.4_0: How is a sentient being defined?”
ai-sn23:2.1.5_0: “Rādha, any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form is spoken of, then a being is spoken of.
ai-sn23:2.1.6_0: If you’re not rid of greed for feeling ...
ai-sn23:2.1.9_0: consciousness, then a being is spoken of.
ai-sn23:2.2.1_0: Suppose some boys or girls were playing with sandcastles.
ai-sn23:2.2.2_0: As long as they’re not rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for those sandcastles, they cherish them, fancy them, treasure them, and treat them as their own.
ai-sn23:2.2.3_0: But when they are rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for those sandcastles, they scatter, destroy, and demolish them with their hands and feet, making them unplayable.
ai-sn23:2.2.4_0: In the same way, you should scatter, destroy, and demolish form, making it unplayable. And you should practice for the ending of craving.
ai-sn23:2.2.5_0: You should scatter, destroy, and demolish feeling ...
ai-sn23:2.2.7_0: making them unplayable. And you should practice for the ending of craving.
ai-sn23:2.2.8_0: consciousness, making it unplayable. And you should practice for the ending of craving.
ai-sn23:2.2.9_0: For the ending of craving is extinguishment.”
ai-sn23:3.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the cessation of attachment to rebirth’.
ai-sn23:3.1.4_0: What is the attachment to rebirth? And what is the cessation of attachment to rebirth?”
ai-sn23:3.1.5_0: “Rādha, any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies—
ai-sn23:3.1.6_0: this is called the attachment to rebirth.
ai-sn23:3.1.7_0: Their cessation is the cessation of attachment to rebirth.
ai-sn23:3.1.8_0: If you’re not rid of greed for feeling ...
ai-sn23:3.1.11_0: consciousness; and any becoming involved, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies—
ai-sn23:3.1.12_0: this is called the attachment to rebirth.
ai-sn23:3.1.13_0: Their cessation is the cessation of attachment to rebirth.”
ai-sn23:4.2.1_0: “Rādha, I will teach you the things that should be completely understood, complete understanding, and the person who has completely understood.
ai-sn23:4.2.2_0: listen and attend closely, I will speak.
ai-sn23:4.2.5_0: “And what things should be completely understood?
ai-sn23:4.2.6_0: Form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:4.2.7_0: These are called the things that should be completely understood.
ai-sn23:4.2.9_0: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-sn23:4.2.11_0: And what is the person who has completely understood?
ai-sn23:4.2.12_0: It should be said: a perfected one,
ai-sn23:4.2.13_0: the venerable of such and such name and clan.
ai-sn23:4.2.14_0: This is called the person who has completely understood.”
ai-sn23:5.1.3_0: “Rādha, there are these five grasping aggregates.
ai-sn23:5.1.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn23:5.1.5_0: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:5.1.6_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape.
ai-sn23:5.1.7_0: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
ai-sn23:5.1.8_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ gratification, drawback, and escape.
ai-sn23:5.1.9_0: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”
ai-sn23:6.1.3_0: “Rādha, there are these five grasping aggregates.
ai-sn23:6.1.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn23:6.1.5_0: That is: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:6.1.6_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand these five grasping aggregates’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape ... Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin ...
ai-sn23:6.1.7_0: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand ...”
ai-sn23:7.1.3_0: “Rādha, there are these five grasping aggregates.
ai-sn23:7.1.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn23:7.1.5_0: That is: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:7.1.6_0: When a noble disciple truly understands these five grasping aggregates’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape,
ai-sn23:7.1.7_0: they’re called a noble disciple who is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
ai-sn23:8.1.3_0: “Rādha, there are these five grasping aggregates.
ai-sn23:8.1.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-sn23:8.1.5_0: That is: form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:8.1.6_0: A mendicant comes to be freed by not grasping after truly understanding these five grasping aggregates’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.
ai-sn23:8.1.7_0: Such a mendicant is called a perfected one, with defilements ended, who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own true goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment.”
ai-sn23:9.1.3_0: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form.
ai-sn23:9.1.4_0: Thus that form will be cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
ai-sn23:9.1.5_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling ...
ai-sn23:9.1.6_0: That’s how they’ve given up feelings.
ai-sn23:9.1.8_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for choices.
ai-sn23:9.1.9_0: Then they’ll have given up choices, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.
ai-sn23:9.1.11_0: Thus that consciousness will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.”
ai-sn23:10.1.3_0: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
ai-sn23:10.1.4_0: Thus that form will be cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
ai-sn23:10.1.5_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling ...
ai-sn23:10.1.6_0: That’s how they’ve given up feelings.
ai-sn23:10.1.8_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for choices; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
ai-sn23:10.1.9_0: Then they’ll have given up choices, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.
ai-sn23:10.1.10_0: consciousness; and any attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendencies.
ai-sn23:10.1.11_0: Thus that consciousness will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.”
ai-sn23:10.1.13_0: The Linked Discourses with Rādha are complete.
ai-sn23:11.1.5_0: “Rādha, form is Māra, feeling is Māra, perception is Māra, choices are Māra, consciousness is Māra.
ai-sn23:11.1.6_0: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-sn23:11.1.7_0: Being repelled, they become desireless. Because they are desireless, they are freed. When they are freed, they know they are freed.
ai-sn23:11.1.8_0: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:11.1.9_0: First the first part of the body.
ai-sn23:12.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra-like nature’.
ai-sn23:12.1.5_0: “Rādha, form has a Māra-like nature. Feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness have a Māra-like nature.
ai-sn23:12.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:13.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘impermanence’.
ai-sn23:13.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are impermanent.
ai-sn23:13.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:14.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘naturally impermanent’.
ai-sn23:14.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are naturally impermanent.
ai-sn23:14.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:15.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘suffering’.
ai-sn23:15.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are suffering.
ai-sn23:15.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:16.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of ‘things that entail suffering’.
ai-sn23:16.1.4_0: What are the things that entail suffering?”
ai-sn23:16.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are things that entail suffering.
ai-sn23:16.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:17.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘not-self’.
ai-sn23:17.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are not-self.
ai-sn23:17.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:18.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘naturally not-self’.
ai-sn23:18.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are naturally not-self.
ai-sn23:18.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:19.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of things being ‘liable to end’.
ai-sn23:19.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to end.
ai-sn23:19.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:20.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of things being ‘liable to vanish’.
ai-sn23:20.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to vanish.
ai-sn23:20.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:21.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of things being ‘liable to originate’.
ai-sn23:21.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to originate.
ai-sn23:21.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:22.1.3_0: “Sir, they speak of things being ‘liable to cease’.
ai-sn23:22.1.5_0: “Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to cease.
ai-sn23:22.1.7_0: They understand: ‘... there is no return to any state of existence.’”
ai-sn23:22.1.9_0: The second sub-chapter onmā is finished.

ai-sn23:23.1.3_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
ai-sn23:23.2.1_0: “Rādha, you should give up desire ... greed ... desire and greed for what is Māra. ...”
ai-sn23:23.2.3_0: Form is Māra. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
ai-sn23:23.2.4_0: You should give up desire for feeling ...
ai-sn23:23.2.6_0: Māra, so you should give up desire for them.
ai-sn23:23.2.7_0: Consciousness is Māra. You should give up desire for it.
ai-sn23:23.2.8_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for it.”
ai-sn23:24.1.1_0: “Rādha, you should give up desire ... greed ... desire and greed for what is liable to be reborn. ...”
ai-sn23:32.1.1_0: “Rādha, the animal realm is liable to vanish ...
ai-sn23:33.1.1_0: “Rādha, all things are liable to originate.
ai-sn23:33.1.1_1: You should give up desire ... greed ... desire and greed for it.
ai-sn23:34.1.2_0: Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
ai-sn23:34.1.3_0: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
ai-sn23:34.2.1_0: “Rādha, you should give up desire ... greed ... desire and greed for what is liable to cease.
ai-sn23:34.2.2_0: And what is liable to cease?
ai-sn23:34.2.3_0: Form is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
ai-sn23:34.2.4_0: They should give up desire for feeling ...
ai-sn23:34.2.7_0: Consciousness is liable to cease. You should give up any desire, any greed, any desire and greed for it.
ai-sn23:34.2.8_0: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for what is liable to cease.”
ai-sn23:34.2.9_0: The third sub-chapter on wishing is finished.
